video:video.video:title: 3D Builder App R5 Release Enhances Design and Print Features
video:video.video:description: You can find me on Twitter here: @gavingear 3D Builder Windows Store app was created to make loading, manipulating and printing 3D models easy and fun. Today, Microsoft has released a major update of&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Arturo Toledo talks about design principles and design language
video:video.video:description: Arturo Toledo is the Chief Architect at Toledo Design (www.toledo2.com). In this video, Arturo talks about the Microsoft design principles as they apply to Windows and Windows Phone apps. He tells us&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Hands-On: TierTime Up Plus 2 3D Printer with Windows 8.1
video:video.video:description: In this video I give an end-to-end demonstration of the TierTime UP Plus 2 3D printer with Windows 8.1. This walk-though includes printing a 3D model (using ABS filament) from the built-in collection&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: Toshiba 4K Laptops Hands-On
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with Carrie Cowan from Toshiba about the exciting new Satellite p50t and Tecra W50 4K Ultra-HD Windows 8.1 laptops coming mid-2014. Full story on the Extreme Windows Blog.

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: AMD Technology Update for 2014
video:video.video:description: In this video I take you on a tour of the AMD technology showcase at CES 2014 including an R290x 5-display Eyefinity setup, the new Kaveri APU, the Radeon R9 M290x mobile APU, and the AMD Project&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: NVIDIA VP Tony Tamasi on PC Gaming in 2014
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with NVIDIA Senior VP Tony Tamasi about what PC gamers have to look forward to in 2014. This is going to be one exciting year for gaming! Here's a high-level summary of some&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES2014: Oculus VR Crystal Cove In-Depth and Hands-On
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with Oculus VR VP Nate Mitchell about the future of Oculus VR technology and tries out the Crystal Cove prototype with Valkyrie, a space game designed around the VR experience.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: MakerBot CEO Bre Pettis Discusses new 3D Printers
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with MakerBot CEO about the exciting new Windows 8.1 compatible 3D printers announced at CES 2014. This new lineup includes the Replicator Mini, Replicator, and Replicator Z18.&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Bleeding Edge Technology for Retail
video:video.video:description: See the new scenarios enabled by Windows Devices in retail settings

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: Panasonic 4K Tablet PC Lineup
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with Panasonic's Kyp Walls about the world's highest resolution tablets, including the just-announced Panasonic 4K tablet performance edition. Full story on the Extreme Windows&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: Hands-On with the Panasonic FZ-M1 7" Rugged Toughpad Tablet
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with Panasonic's Dan Diliberti about the recently announced Panasonic Toughpad FZ-M1 7&quot; Rugged Tablet (and give it the obligatory drop test). You can read more about the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: CES 2014: Razer Shows Project Christine PC Concept
video:video.video:description: In this video I talk with Young Bae from Razer PC about the amazing Project Christine PC concept shown at CES 2014. You can read the full story on the Extreme Windows Blog here.

video:video.video:title: From 3D Scanner to 3D Printer on Windows 8.1
video:video.video:description: In this video I give a demonstration of 3D scanning and 3D printing on Windows 8.1 using the new MakerBot Digitizer Desktop 3D Scanner and the MakerBot Replicator 2 3D printer. Using the 3D Builder&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Hands-On with Oculus Rift and the Oculus SDK
video:video.video:description: In this video, I demonstrate how the Oculus Rift Development Kit works with DirectX games. You'll a demonstration of playing Euro Truck Simulator 2 using Oculus Rift for head tracking and an Xbox game&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tiled Resources for DirectX in Windows 8.1
video:video.video:description: Antoine Leblond demos tiled resources for DirectX in Windows 8.1.

video:video.video:title: CEO Bre Pettis on MakerBot History, Windows 8.1 Integration
video:video.video:description: During my recent trip to Maker Faire 2013 in NYC I had the opportunity to visit the nearby MakerBot retail store and headquarters. During these visits I got to talk with CEO Bre Pettis and learn about&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft @ Maker Faire 2013 NYC
video:video.video:description: Microsoft had a huge presence this year at Maker Faire 2013 in NYC! People visiting the Microsoft Maker Faire tent got to get hands-on with a wide range of cool tech like Project Spark, an&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Project E.B.T.R. Racing Simulator Moves You Literally
video:video.video:description: Full story: http://bit.ly/18l4rXk In this video I talk with Chris Stevenson about Project E.B.T.R., a Windows 8 powered full motion racing simulator. Watch the video to see Chris show me&quot;how it's&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Demo: 3D Printing Support in Windows 8.1
video:video.video:description: In this video I give an overview of 3D printing support in Windows 8.1 and a demo of printing a 3D object from a Windows Store app to a 3D Systems Cube 2 printer using Windows 8.1 Preview build. Be&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Pushing the 12K Boundary in PC Gaming
video:video.video:description: In this video I start by running Dirt3 on Windows 8 at 11,520 x 2,160 resolution (3 x 4K Ultra HD) at 30 Hz. Next, I show Dirt3 on a single 4K Ultra HD display (3,840 x 2,160) resolution using&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows 8 Task Manager In-Depth
video:video.video:description: Full story here: http://bit.ly/111QFWO In this video I walk through the new and updated Task Manager in Windows 8. You'll see demos of the following areas: processes, performance, startup, details,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: How To: Setup and use File History on Windows 8
video:video.video:description: In this video, I demonstrate one of the great new features in Windows 8: File History. File history keeps a chronological history of your files automatically, and it's easy to restore data when you&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Extreme Gaming at 146 FPS with AMD CrossFire and triple display setup
video:video.video:description: In this video, Larry and Gavin go extreme by setting up a dual AMD 7970 CrossFire setup, and then showing a 3:1 1080p (5760x1080) Eyefinity setup with Battlefield 3 running on Windows 8 at up to 146&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Torture Testing Fun: Panasonic Toughbook Tablet PC
video:video.video:description: In this video I show just how tough the Panasonic Toughbook H2 tablet PC is. For fun, I attached a GoPro HERO 3 camera to the Toughbook H2 to capture the action (along with two other cameras for this&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Interview with RED Digital Cinema Co-Founder Ted Schilowitz
video:video.video:description: In the following video, Ted Schilowitz talks about RED Digital Cinema education programs and why they are using Windows to power post production. Ted gives some interesting insights about kids and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Wrenching on the HP 8770w Worksation Laptop
video:video.video:description: In this video I show you just how easy it is to work on the HP 8770w workstation PC. I'll demonstrate how you can swap out two RAM DIMMs and two hard drives in about 3 minutes with this machine.

video:video.video:title: Quick Look: PC Gaming in 4K on Windows 8
video:video.video:description: In this video, I show a quick demonstration of DirectX 11 gaming with a 4K display running Windows 8. For more information, please visit the Extreme Windows Blog post here.

video:video.video:title: Z820 RED Edition PC and Windows 8 4K Multi-Mon
video:video.video:description: In this video, I demonstrate the HP Z820 RED Edition PC running Windows 8 and a 4K &#43; 2 WQHD tri-mon setup. I also show live manipulation and screening of 4K footage shot on a RED Epic camera using&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Emirates Airline Serves Up New Inflight Experiences with Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Emirates Airline Serves Up New Inflight Experiences with Windows 8

video:video.video:title: RED 4K Windows Post Production Overview
video:video.video:description: In this video, I give a demonstration of using REDCINE-X Pro and Adobe Premiere Pro CS6 to work with 4K digital cinema footage shot with the RED EPIC camera.

video:video.video:title: Kinect for Windows: Interview witih Rob Relyea
video:video.video:description: In this video, I interview Rob Relyea who gives a guided tour of Kinect SDK 1.5 functionality, and shows features from the next version including extended depth data and color camera settings. To&#8230;

video:video.video:title: HP Z1 All-In-One Workstation PC and Adobe After Effects CS6
video:video.video:description: In this video I give an overview of the HP Z1 all-in-one workstation PC. Included are an overview of the machine, demonstration of Adobe After Effects CS6 in action, and a walkthrough of the internal&#8230;

video:video.video:title: NVIDIA GTX 660 Ti Graphics Card: Affordable Graphics Powerhouse
video:video.video:description: In this video, I install the new NVIDIA GTX 660 Ti graphics card in my HP Z820 in 36 seconds, and then give you a quick demo of Max Payne 3 (Direct X 11 Game). This demo is running at 2560 x 1440&#8230;

video:video.video:title: HP Z820 - Rising To the Challenge
video:video.video:description: In this video, I show the HP Z820 workstation PC in use with Adobe CS6, and also provide a guided tour around and inside the PC to show its features and construction. To view the full write-up, you&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Windows Movie Maker Video Stabilization
video:video.video:description: Windows Movie Maker Video Stabilization Demo.

video:video.video:title: PDXLAN 20 Event Coverage
video:video.video:description: In this video I give a quick overview of the PDXLAN 20 LAN party. With 550 gamers, pc builders, and general enthusiasts under one roof, this was an awesome event. If you want to know more about&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Human Presence Detection With Kinect
video:video.video:description: This video was created to chronicle my one-day challenge to write a Kinect for Windows app for human presence detection. You can read the complete write-up by checking out the full post on the Extreme&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Providing a Consistent and Personal Experience with Microsoft User Experience Virtualization
video:video.video:description: A.J. Smith, Senior Product Marketing Manager for Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) shows how the product provides a consistent and personal experience for an application that is deployed&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Flexible Virtualization with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0
video:video.video:description: Microsoft Senior Product Marketing Manager Dave Trupkin uses the App-V 5.0 Beta's web-based management console to easily connect virtual applications, allowing them to interact.

video:video.video:title: What Windows 8 Consumer Preview Means for Your Business
video:video.video:description: Tami Reller, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Marketing Officer, Windows and Windows Live, talks about the business features of Windows 8 Consumer Preview.

video:video.video:title: Windows 8 Consumer Preview Demo
video:video.video:description: Jensen Harris, Director of Program Management for Windows User Experience, gives a demo of the Windows 8 Consumer Preview. Download it now!

video:video.video:title: Meet Windows 8
video:video.video:description: Meet Windows 8! Get started with the Windows 8 Consumer Preview and experience Windows 8 for yourself. More info here: http://win8.ms/dthzvf.

video:video.video:title: Ben E. Keith Gets Rugged with Windows 7
video:video.video:description: Ben E. Keith's Vice President of Administration and Information, Steve Fleming, talks about implementing the MobileDemand xTablet T7000 devices equipped with Windows 7.

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Nokia Kinetic Device
video:video.video:description: Nokia Kinetic Device lets you control your phone by flexing the case. It's a completely new way of working with a device.

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Demo of the Xbox Companion App
video:video.video:description: Control your Xbox from your Windows Phone with the Xbox Companion App. Find &amp; learn about content, too!

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Kevin Shields on Nokia's "extreme product making"
video:video.video:description: Nokia SVP Kevin Shields explains why Nokia is obsessed with &quot;extreme product making&quot;, and why a Nokia phone looks great, feels great and performs great.

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Interview with Jo Harlow, Nokia EVP of Smart Devices
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Jo Harlow, Nokia's EVP of Smart Devices, talk about why the announcement of the Nokia Lumia 800 and Lumia 710 is so important for the smartphone industry - and smartphone customers.

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Nokia Drive gets you where you need to go
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy gets a tour of Nokia Drive, Nokia's voice-guided turn-by-turn personal navigation assistant.

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Nokia Music makes music personal & portable
video:video.video:description: Get a look at how Nokia Music works, looks and sounds from Ben the PC Guy

video:video.video:title: Live from Nokia World 2011: Kinectimals for Windows Phone
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy gets a sneak peek at the upcoming Windows Phone game Kinectimals and shows how you can move your game from your Phone to your Xbox and back to your phone using Kinectivity.

video:video.video:title: Tech Tuesday Live Twitter Chat at the Bellevue Microsoft Store
video:video.video:description: Join Windows Tuesday Oct. 11th for our Tech Tuesday Live Twitter Chat at the Bellevue Microsoft Store to talk about PCs and IE9.

video:video.video:title: How to use Snap in Windows 7
video:video.video:description: This video shows you how to use Snap in Windows 7 to compare things. This video was originally posted to Windows.com here.

video:video.video:title: What are Windows engineers most excited about for Windows 8?
video:video.video:description: Hardworking Windows engineers share the things they are most excited about with the upcoming Windows 8.

video:video.video:title: Ben and Ryan Explain: AMD Processors
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Ryan Asdourian take you on a tour of AMD's latest processors.

video:video.video:title: Roundup: Commercial-Grade PCs
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Lee Sabow from the Windows Commercial Marketing Team explain what makes commercial and consumer grade PCs different, and why commercial PCs matter to businesses small and large.

video:video.video:title: Inside the indestructible world of ruggedized PCs
video:video.video:description: Can rugged PCs REALLY stand up to sand, water, shock and heat? Ben the PC Guy and Lee Sabow put them to the test.

video:video.video:title: Taking & sharing great photos with Windows Phone, SkyDrive, and Windows Live Photo Gallery
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy shows just a few of the amazing things you can do with photos when you bring together a Windows 7 PC, a Windows Phone, and Windows Live.

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Sony VAIO Y
video:video.video:description: Need a great-looking, super-portable PC for under $500? Ben the PC Guy has one that fits the bill - the powerful new Sony VAIO Y.

video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy takes a look at the Toshiba Satellite A665 3D laptop. It's a beautiful, powerful gaming PC for about

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Dell Vostro v130
video:video.video:description: Need an inexpensive laptop with great battery life, powerful specs and beautiful design? Look no further than the Dell Vostro v130.

video:video.video:title: Windows Intune Customer Showcase
video:video.video:description: Check outt his video highlighting Windows Intune customers! Friendship Heights Rehabilitation Center talks about deploying Windows Intune to manage their PCs and standardize on Windows 7. Friendship&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: ASUS U36JC
video:video.video:description: Ryan Asdourian takes you on a tour of the thin, powerful ASUS U36J.

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Samsung QX410 and SF510
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Ryan Asdourian give the lowdown on two of Samsung's oustanding consumer laptops.

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Sony VAIO SB
video:video.video:description: Looking for a new ultraportable for work or school? Be sure to check out the new Sony VAIO SB that gets you a core i5 processor, 4GB of RAM, a 500GB HD and up to 15 hours of battery life for around&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Ben and Ryan Explain: Windows Live Mesh
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Ryan Asdourian show you how to keep your stuff in sync across multiple PCs using Windows Live Mesh

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Lenovo U160 & Lenovo U260
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy and Ryan Asdourian show off two great ultraportable from Lenovo, the IdeaPad U160 and IdeaPad U260.

video:video.video:title: The Emulator
video:video.video:description: A Windows 7 Tablet running Emulator software used for DJ'ing.

video:video.video:title: Ben & Ryan share some of the best PCs for the Back to School season
video:video.video:description: Heading off to college? Gearing up for high school? That means it's time for a new PC! Ben the PC Guy and Ryan Asdourian share their recommendations on PCs that will help you get your work done,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: Toshiba Portege r705
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy gives the 2-minute rundown of the Toshiba Portege r705, the lightest full-feaured laptop with an optical drive.

video:video.video:title: The San Diego Unified School District talks about their Windows 7 Deployment
video:video.video:description: Staff members at the San Diego Unified School District discuss deploying Windows 7.

video:video.video:title: PC Snapshot: HP Envy 14
video:video.video:description: Ryan Asdourian gives a short overview of the HP Envy 14, one of the best PCs for music lovers on the market today.

video:video.video:title: Feeding America deploys Windows 7
video:video.video:description: Patrick Whalen, Director of Infrastructure Services at Feeding America, discussing their deployment of Windows 7. Their deployment of Windows 7 is 100% complete.

video:video.video:title: A look inside Origin's amazing custom gaming PC factory
video:video.video:description: Join Ben the PC Guy for tour of the factory where Origin hand-builds all of their beautiful, completely custom gaming laptops and desktops.

video:video.video:title: Aspectos más destacados de la feria de computadores en Miami
video:video.video:description: No pudo asistir a Miami? No hay problema, vea el videoen el Gustavo Blum visita toda la feria y hace una selección de los PCs másdestacados

video:video.video:title: Highlights from the Miami PC Showcase
video:video.video:description: Couldn't make it to Miami? No problem! Join Ben the PC Guy for a start-to-finish tour of the Miami PC Showcase and a roundup of his favorite gear from the show.

video:video.video:title: Tri-Center Community School Talks About Windows MultiPoint Server
video:video.video:description: Windows MultiPoint Server allows Iowa school to make instruction more productive in the classroom.

video:video.video:title: Windows MultiPoint Server Makes Technology Access More Affordable
video:video.video:description: Students in the Czech Republic gain 21st century skills through Windows MultiPoint Server.

video:video.video:title: First impressions of the Samsung 900x
video:video.video:description: Ben the PC Guy shares his first impressions with the bafflingly thin, incredibly light, surprisingly powerful Samsung 900x.

video:video.video:title: Ben and Ryan Explain: Screen Resolution
video:video.video:description: Think a bigger screen means you'll be able to fit more stuff on it? Think again! Ben and Ryan explain what screen size and screen resolution really mean, and what you should lookl for when buying&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Creating a new Celtic sound scheme for Windows 7
video:video.video:description: Jennifer Shepherd visits with the producer, engineer, and musicians who contributed to the new Windows 7 sound scheme based on traditional Celtic music.

video:video.video:title: Ben and Ryan Explain: Hard Drives vs. Solid-State Drives
video:video.video:description: Ben &quot;The PC Guy&quot; Rudolph and Ryan Asdourian explain the difference in performance, price and storage capacity between traditional spinning hard drives and new solid-state drives.

video:video.video:title: A walk-through of Windows MultiPoint Server 2011
video:video.video:description: Dean Paron from the Windows MultiPoint Server Team takes us through their latest release - Windows MultiPoint Server 2011.

video:video.video:title: Ben the PC Guy & Ryan Asdourian show off the Spring's hottest PCs
video:video.video:description: Spring is coming! Why not celebrate the season with a brand new PC? Ben and Ryan give the lowdown on some of the season's best new PCs, like the Acer TimelineX 1830, ASUS U36Jc, Dell XPS 14, HP&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Watching Recorded TV Shows from Windows Media Center Remotely
video:video.video:description: Pete Brown, who you may know from the Extreme Windows Blog and The Green Button, talks about using Windows 7's Remote Media Streaming feature with his son to watch Recorded TV shows from Windows&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Our resident mommy blogger Lisa checks out the Where's Waldo game
video:video.video:description: Wheres Waldo game (by Wild Tangent) reviewed by WinMommyLisas daughter on Dell Studio 17 touch notebook.

video:video.video:title: MultiPoint Server 2011: Prepare students for their futures
video:video.video:description: Windows MultiPoint Server 2011 helps Sultan School Districts reach its technology vision.

video:video.video:title: MultiPoint Server 2011: Integrates with Windows 7 Group Policies
video:video.video:description: Bellevue School District used their existing Windows 7 policies to lock down MultiPoint Server settings.

video:video.video:title: MultiPoint Server 2011: Repurpose old hardware
video:video.video:description: Dave Moon, technology coordinator at Sultan School District, dusts off old computers and puts them back into commission, saving money in the process.

video:video.video:title: MultiPoint Server 2011: Reduce the average cost per PC
video:video.video:description: Hear how Jason Golec, manager of network operations from Bellevue School District, reduced his cost per PC from $1200 to $800 with MultiPoint Server.

video:video.video:title: MultiPoint Server 2011: Manage fewer computers
video:video.video:description: Sultan School Districts superintendent, Dan Chaplik, explains how MultiPoint Server helps his IT staff more effectively manage their workload.

video:video.video:title: Windows at CES 2011: Conclusion
video:video.video:description: Ben &quot;The PC Guy&quot; Rudolph signs off in Las Vegas completing the series of Windows at CES 2011 videos. Of course, that doesn't mean there won't be anymore videos!

video:video.video:description: Ben The PC Guy Rudolph gets a run-through of Toshibas new laptop lineup on the show floor at CES 2011.

video:video.video:description: Ben Rudolph (Ben the PC Guy) and Ryan Asdourian visit the home of the Seattle Seahawks - Qwest Field - to power the Jumbotron with a Windows 7 PC. See Ben's original blog post on the Windows&#8230;
